content: I thought we already had TWO days: Memorial Day and Veterans Day. How many days do we need? There's not a "Korea" Day, "Civil War Day," "Frontier Campaign Day," "Spanish-American War Day," "Revolutionary or War of 1812 Day," "Desert Storm" Day or - so far - an "Iraq Day" or "Afghanistan Day." What makes us any more special than any of those military people?
reply: I thought we already had TWO days: Memorial Day and Veterans Day. How many days do we need? content: Yea yea yea, nice to know someone cares, but hey, help the VA to get their shcit together. Dennis has been trying to get a hearing aid for 2 years. content: quote: Originally posted by Cider33_Alpha: I thought we already had TWO days: Memorial Day and Veterans Day. How many days do we need? There's not a "Korea" Day, "Civil War Day," "Frontier Campaign Day," "Spanish-American War Day," "Revolutionary or War of 1812 Day," "Desert Storm" Day or - so far - an "Iraq Day" or "Afghanistan Day." What makes us any more special than any of those military people? The Nam was a different kind of war. I guess you had to be there to fully understand. If you weren't then trying to explain is useless. We never asked for a special day, we just wanted the recognition due us for our efforts. We are finally starting to get it riding on the backs of today's warriors. Are we special? No!, just different. Ever been spit on lady?

We never asked for a special day, we just wanted the recognition due us for our efforts. We are finally starting to get it riding on the backs of today's warriors. Are we special? No!, just different. Ever been spit on lady?
title: VIETNAM VET's DAY

content: Why March, the month of War? Cold anyway.... Seems like in June or August, when you can have a parade, wave a flag, have a few hotdogs, pat a few guys on the back and thank 'em, without having to dive out of a snowstorm or something - - I mean, wouldn't a sultry June or August day seem more appropriate - so those that wanted to could wear their old jungle fatigues and not freeze their azzes off? Congress got no clue - - Wandering and Wondering
reply: Why March, the month of War? Cold anyway.... Seems like in June or August, when you can have a parade, wave a flag, have a few hotdogs, pat a few guys on the back and thank 'em, without having to dive out of a snowstorm or something - - I mean, wouldn't a sultry June or August day seem more appropriate - so those that wanted to could wear their old jungle fatigues and not freeze their azzes off? Congress got no clue - - Wandering and Wondering
title: VIETNAM VET's DAY

content: quote: Originally posted by RetiredMarineWife: Yea yea yea, nice to know someone cares, but hey, help the VA to get their shcit together. Dennis has been trying to get a hearing aid for 2 years. He received a letter from the VA in Waco requesting his medical. The idiots have his medical. USMC mailed all of his medical and dental to the VA in Waco. I tell you, if he doesn't get a hearing aid real soon I may hurt him......... But joking aside..... Never, EVER depend upon someone else to provide evidence of your claim. Send it yourself. Even if that someone else does send it, and you do to, it's better for the adjudicator to have two copies than none. And, that includes the VA. Even though his health records are computerized and they're supposed to be provided, don't assume they will be. That adjudicator has no obligation to find evidence for your claim, so go down to records release at your local VA and get copies and send them in. And, for God's sake....NEVER send the original of anything and keep copies!
quote: Originally posted by RetiredMarineWife: Yea yea yea, nice to know someone cares, but hey, help the VA to get their shcit together. Dennis has been trying to get a hearing aid for 2 years. He received a letter from the VA in Waco requesting his medical. The idiots have his medical. USMC mailed all of his medical and dental to the VA in Waco. I tell you, if he doesn't get a hearing aid real soon I may hurt him......... But joking aside.....
reply: Never, EVER depend upon someone else to provide evidence of your claim. Send it yourself. Even if that someone else does send it, and you do to, it's better for the adjudicator to have two copies than none. And, that includes the VA. Even though his health records are computerized and they're supposed to be provided, don't assume they will be. That adjudicator has no obligation to find evidence for your claim, so go down to records release at your local VA and get copies and send them in. And, for God's sake....NEVER send the original of anything and keep copies!

Seems like in June or August, when you can have a parade, wave a flag, have a few hotdogs, pat a few guys on the back and thank 'em, without having to dive out of a snowstorm or something - - I mean, wouldn't a sultry June or August day seem more appropriate - so those that wanted to could wear their old jungle fatigues and not freeze their azzes off? Congress got no clue - - Wandering and Wondering
title: VIETNAM VET's DAY

content: quote: Originally posted by RetiredMarineWife: Yea yea yea, nice to know someone cares, but hey, help the VA to get their shcit together. Dennis has been trying to get a hearing aid for 2 years. He received a letter from the VA in Waco requesting his medical. The idiots have his medical. USMC mailed all of his medical and dental to the VA in Waco. I tell you, if he doesn't get a hearing aid real soon I may hurt him......... But joking aside..... Never, EVER depend upon someone else to provide evidence of your claim. Send it yourself. Even if that someone else does send it, and you do to, it's better for the adjudicator to have two copies than none. And, that includes the VA. Even though his health records are computerized and they're supposed to be provided, don't assume they will be. That adjudicator has no obligation to find evidence for your claim, so go down to records release at your local VA and get copies and send them in. And, for God's sake....NEVER send the original of anything and keep copies!
quote: Originally posted by RetiredMarineWife: Yea yea yea, nice to know someone cares, but hey, help the VA to get their shcit together. Dennis has been trying to get a hearing aid for 2 years. He received a letter from the VA in Waco requesting his medical. The idiots have his medical. USMC mailed all of his medical and dental to the VA in Waco. I tell you, if he doesn't get a hearing aid real soon I may hurt him......... But joking aside.....

Even if that someone else does send it, and you do to, it's better for the adjudicator to have two copies than none. And, that includes the VA. Even though his health records are computerized and they're supposed to be provided, don't assume they will be. That adjudicator has no obligation to find evidence for your claim, so go down to records release at your local VA and get copies and send them in. And, for God's sake....NEVER send the original of anything and keep copies!
title: VIETNAM VET's DAY
